member.name: T:Checkbox.Wcf.Services.Proxies.AclEntry
member.summary: A lightweight object which describes an Access Control List (ACL) entry.

member.name: P:Checkbox.Wcf.Services.Proxies.AclEntry.EntryType
member.summary:
Indicates the type of the the entity.
Entries will either be a user or user group.
User will be of type: "Prezza.Framework.Security.ExtendedPrincipal"
User groups will be of type: "Checkbox.Users.Group"

member.name: P:Checkbox.Wcf.Services.Proxies.AclEntry.EntryIdentifier
member.summary:
The unique identifier of entity being granted access.
If the entity is a user the value is their unique identifier.
If the entity is a user groups, the value is the group id as a string. In most cases the value will need to be cast to an int before it can be used.

member.name: P:Checkbox.Wcf.Services.Proxies.AclEntry.AclPolicyId
member.summary: Database id of policy associated with ACL entry

member.name: P:Checkbox.Wcf.Services.Proxies.AclEntry.ShortEntryIdentifier
member.summary:
A truncated version of the FullEntryIdentifier.
If the EntryType is a user the identifier is the user's unique identifier.
If the EntryType is a user group the identifier will be the group's name.

remarks.para: If the EntryType is a user the identifier is the user's unique identifier.
If the EntryType is a user group the identifier will be the group's name.

member.remarks:
Available Roles:
Group Administrator - Is capable of managing user groups.
Report Administrator - Is capable of creating and managing reports.
Report Viewer - Is capable of viewing reports.
Respondent - Is capable of responding to surveys.
Survey Administrator - Is capable creating, editing and activating surveys.
Survey Editor - Is capable editing existing surveys.
System Administrator - Is a super user that has no restricted actions.
User Administrator - Is capable of creating and managing user accounts.

member.remarks:
Available Roles:
Group Administrator - Is capable of managing user groups.
Report Administrator - Is capable of creating and managing reports.
Report Viewer - Is capable of viewing reports.
Respondent - Is capable of responding to surveys.
Survey Administrator - Is capable creating, editing and activating surveys.
Survey Editor - Is capable editing existing surveys.
System Administrator - Is a super user that has no restricted actions.
User Administrator - Is capable of creating and managing user accounts.

Contains data associated with an instance of an item (in a survey or report) along with a simplified version of any item meta data necessary for a renderer to display an item.
